metadata.title: CVE-2021-30560 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in Blink XSLT in Google Chrome prior to 91.0.4472.164allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxslt1.1 - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.3+esm1
python-libxslt1 - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.3+esm1
xsltproc - 1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.3+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libxslt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.28-2.1ubuntu0.3+esm1').
